page.title: 09Fire station
page.content: We surveyed square 2306 and found it was partly residential but largely farmland.The most interesting feature of this area is the fire station. The fireman told us they get about 10 calls a week,and 415 calls a year.It was the first computerised station in Britain.A fire engine can hold 400 gallons of water.The ladder is 14 metres triple extension.Some fires cannot be put out by water.They use foam made of pigs bones and cows blood,or carbon dioxide.They had been called to the Grand Hotel bombing.We were allowed to go on the fire engine. It was quite big and can carry 5 people.The seats were very hard. He also showed us the hats and coats they wear. By Tara.
